Node.definition: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= town, formerly known as Kiriath Arba (קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע) ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► assigned to clan of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)
= first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing
= man, also known as Aminon (אֲמִינֹון) ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) ► raped his sister Thamar (תָּמָר) and was killed by his brother Absalom (אַבְשָׁלֹום)
= woman; ► wife of David (דָּוִד) from Jezreel (יִזְרְעֶאל)
= inhabitant of town or valley of Jezreel (יִזְרְעֶאל)
= state in which a countable entity is the second in a range
= man, also known as Chileab (כִּלְאָב) ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) and his wife Abigail (אֲבִיגַיִל)
= woman, also known as Abigal (אֲבִיגַל) ► wife of Nabal (נָבָל) who later married king David (דָּוִד)
= inhabitant of Carmel (כַּרְמֶל) ◄ located in the hill country (הַר) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= state in which a countable entity is the third in a range
= man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) ► attempted to become king in his father's place but was killed in the attempt
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= woman; ◄ daughter of Talmai (תַּלְמַי) king of Geshur (גְּשׁוּר) ► wife of David (דָּוִד) mother of Absalom (אַבְשָׁלֹום)
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► king of Geshur (גְּשׁוּר) father of Maacah (מַעֲכָה) wife of David (דָּוִד) and mother of Absalom (אַבְשָׁלֹום)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= kingdom; ◄ located between Gilead (גִּלְעָד) Bashan (בָּשָׁן) and Mt. Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) ► not conquered by Israelites
= state in which a countable entity is the fourth in a range
= man; ► son of David (דָּוִד) ► who wanted to be king instead of his brother Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= woman; ► wife of king David (דָּוִד) mother of Adonijah (אֲדֹנִיָּה)
= state in which a countable entity is the fifth in a range
= man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד)
= woman; ► wife of David (דָּוִד) mother of Shephatiah (שְׁפַטְיָה)

= man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד)
= woman; ► wife of David (דָּוִד)
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which a countable entity is six in number
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= state in which a countable entity is six in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is thirty in number
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
